title: Scott's trick; collection principle; Hilbert's epsilon

blocks.name: scottex
blocks.content: Scott's trick collects all sets that have a certain property and are of the smallest possible rank. This theorem shows that the resulting collection, expressed as in Equation 9.3 of [Jech] p. 72, is a set. (Contributed by NM, 13-Oct-2003.)

thm scottex(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  ⊢ { s0 ∈ c0 | ∀(s1 ∈ c0,(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))} ∈ 𝕌
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  pm2.61i({ s0 ∈ c0 | ∀(s1 ∈ c0,(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))} ∈ 𝕌, c0 = ∅)
  syl(c0 = ∅, { s0 ∈ c0 | ∀(s1 ∈ c0,(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))} ∈ 𝕌, c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  mpbiri(c0 = ∅, c0 ∈ 𝕌, ∅ ∈ 𝕌)
  0ex()
  eleq1(c0, emptycls, universe)
  rabexg(s0, c0, universe, ∀(s1 ∈ c0,(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1)))
  sylbi(¬ c0 = ∅, { s0 ∈ c0 | ∀(s1 ∈ c0,(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))} ∈ 𝕌, ∃(s1, s1 ∈ c0))
  neq0(s1, c0)
  exlimi(s1, s1 ∈ c0, { s0 ∈ c0 | ∀(s1 ∈ c0,(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))} ∈ 𝕌)
  nfel1(s1, { s0 ∈ c0 | ∀(s1 ∈ c0,(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))}, universe)
  nfrab(s1, s0, c0, ∀(s1 ∈ c0,(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1)))
  nfra1(s1, c0, (rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))
  nfcv(s1, c0)
  syl(s1 ∈ c0, { s0 ∈ c0 | ∀(s1 ∈ c0,(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))} ∈ 𝕌, { s0 ∈ c0 | ∀(s1 ∈ c0,(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))} ⊆ { s0 ∈ c0 |(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1)})
  sylibr(s1 ∈ c0, { s0 ∈ c0 | ∀(s1 ∈ c0,(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))} ⊆ { s0 ∈ c0 |(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1)}, ∀(s0 ∈ c0,(∀(s1 ∈ c0,(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))→(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))))
  ralrimivw(s0, c0, s1 ∈ c0, (∀(s1 ∈ c0,(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))→(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1)))
  com12(s1 ∈ c0, ∀(s1 ∈ c0,(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1)), (rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))
  rsp(s1, c0, (rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))
  ss2rab(s0, c0, ∀(s1 ∈ c0,(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1)), (rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))
  ssex({ s0 ∈ c0 | ∀(s1 ∈ c0,(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))}, { s0 ∈ c0 |(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1)})
  ax-mp({ s0 ∈ c0 |(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1)} ∈ 𝕌, ∃(hs1 ∈ On, ∀(hs0 ∈ { s0 ∈ c0 |(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1)},(rank ` hs0)⊆ hs1)))
  mp2an(∃(hs1 ∈ On, ∀(hs0 ∈ { s0 ∈ c0 |(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1)},(rank ` hs0)⊆ hs1)), (rank ` s1)∈ On, ∀(hs0 ∈ { s0 ∈ c0 |(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1)},(rank ` hs0)⊆(rank ` s1)))
  rankon(s1)
  rgen(hs0, { s0 ∈ c0 |(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1)}, (rank ` hs0)⊆(rank ` s1))
  simprbi(hs0 ∈ { s0 ∈ c0 |(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1)}, (rank ` hs0)⊆(rank ` s1), hs0 ∈ c0)
  elrab(s0, hs0, c0, (rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1), (rank ` hs0)⊆(rank ` s1))
  sseq1d((rank ` s0), (rank ` s1), (rank ` hs0), s0 = hs0)
  fveq2(s0, hs0, crnk)
  rspcev(hs1, (rank ` s1), con0, ∀(hs0 ∈ { s0 ∈ c0 |(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1)},(rank ` hs0)⊆(rank ` s1)), ∀(hs0 ∈ { s0 ∈ c0 |(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1)},(rank ` hs0)⊆ hs1))
  ralbidv(hs0, { s0 ∈ c0 |(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1)}, hs1 =(rank ` s1), (rank ` hs0)⊆ hs1, (rank ` hs0)⊆(rank ` s1))
  sseq2(hs1, (rank ` s1), (rank ` hs0))
  bndrank(hs1, hs0, { s0 ∈ c0 |(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1)})
  diff.universe.s(s1)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, s1, c0)
  diff.wss.s(s0, (rank ` hs0), (rank ` s1))
  diff.cfv.s(s0, crnk, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cfv.s(s0, crnk, s1)
  diff.crnk.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.hs1.c((rank ` s1))
  diff.hs1.c(con0)
  diff.hs1.w(∀(hs0 ∈ { s0 ∈ c0 |(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1)},(rank ` hs0)⊆(rank ` s1)))
  diff.hs0.w(hs1 =(rank ` s1))
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
  diff.hs1.c({ s0 ∈ c0 |(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1)})
  diff.hs0.c({ s0 ∈ c0 |(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1)})
}

blocks.name: scott0
blocks.content: Scott's trick collects all sets that have a certain property and are of the smallest possible rank. This theorem shows that the resulting collection, expressed as in Equation 9.3 of [Jech] p. 72, contains at least one representative with the property, if there is one. In other words, the collection is empty iff no set has the property (i.e. ` A ` is empty). (Contributed by NM, 15-Oct-2003.)

thm scott0s(setvar s0, setvar s1, wff w0) {

  scott0(hs0, s1, { s0 | w0 })
  eqeq1i({ hs0 ∈ { s0 | w0 } | ∀(s1 ∈ { s0 | w0 },(rank ` hs0)⊆(rank ` s1))}, emptycls, { s0 |(w0 ∧ ∀(s1,([s1 / s0]w0 →(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))))})
  3eqtri({ hs0 ∈ { s0 | w0 } | ∀(s1 ∈ { s0 | w0 },(rank ` hs0)⊆(rank ` s1))}, { s0 |(w0 ∧ ∀(s1,([s1 / s0]w0 →(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))))}, { s0 ∈ { s0 | w0 } | ∀(s1 ∈ { s0 | w0 },(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))}, { s0 |(s0 ∈ { s0 | w0 } ∧ ∀(s1 ∈ { s0 | w0 },(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1)))})
  cbvrab(hs0, s0, { s0 | w0 }, ∀(s1 ∈ { s0 | w0 },(rank ` hs0)⊆(rank ` s1)), ∀(s1 ∈ { s0 | w0 },(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1)))

  fveq2(hs0, s0, crnk)
  df-rab(s0, { s0 | w0 }, ∀(s1 ∈ { s0 | w0 },(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1)))
  abbii(s0, (s0 ∈ { s0 | w0 } ∧ ∀(s1 ∈ { s0 | w0 },(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))), (w0 ∧ ∀(s1,([s1 / s0]w0 →(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1)))))
  anbi12i(s0 ∈ { s0 | w0 }, ∀(s1 ∈ { s0 | w0 },(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1)), w0, ∀(s1,([s1 / s0]w0 →(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))))
  abid(s0, w0)

  df-ral(s1, { s0 | w0 }, (rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))

thm cplem1(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wral(s0, c0, wi(wne(c1, emptycls), wne(cin(c1, c2), emptycls)))
  -| wceq(c3, crab(s1, c1, wral(s2, c1, wss(cfv(crnk, cv(s1)), cfv(crnk, cv(s2))))))
  -| wceq(c2, ciun(s0, c0, c3))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
} = {
  a1ii(wral(s0, c0, wi(wne(c1, emptycls), wne(cin(c1, c2), emptycls))), diffss(s0, s1))
  a1ii(wral(s0, c0, wi(wne(c1, emptycls), wne(cin(c1, c2), emptycls))), diffss(s0, s2))
  a1ii(wral(s0, c0, wi(wne(c1, emptycls), wne(cin(c1, c2), emptycls))), diffsc(s0, c0))
  a1ii(wral(s0, c0, wi(wne(c1, emptycls), wne(cin(c1, c2), emptycls))), diffsc(s1, c0))
  a1ii(wral(s0, c0, wi(wne(c1, emptycls), wne(cin(c1, c2), emptycls))), diffsc(s2, c0))
  rgen(s0, c0, wi(wne(c1, emptycls), wne(cin(c1, c2), emptycls)))
  syl5bi(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wne(c1, emptycls), wne(cin(c1, c2), emptycls), wex(hs0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3)))
  bitri(wne(c1, emptycls), wex(hs0, wcel(cv(hs0), c3)), wne(c3, emptycls))
  necon3bii(c1, emptycls, c3, emptycls)
  bitr4i(wceq(c1, emptycls), wceq(c3, emptycls), wceq(crab(s1, c1, wral(s2, c1, wss(cfv(crnk, cv(s1)), cfv(crnk, cv(s2))))), emptycls))
  scott0(s1, s2, c1)
  eqeq1i(c3, emptycls, crab(s1, c1, wral(s2, c1, wss(cfv(crnk, cv(s1)), cfv(crnk, cv(s2))))))
  n0(hs0, c3)
  exlimdv(hs0, wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c3), wne(cin(c1, c2), emptycls))
  syl6(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c3), wne(cin(c1, c2), emptycls), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))
  jcad(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs0), c2))
  a1i(wcel(cv(s0), c0), wi(wcel(cv(hs0), c3), wcel(cv(hs0), c1)))
  sseli(cv(hs0), c3, c1)
  ssrab3(s1, c3, c1, wral(s2, c1, wss(cfv(crnk, cv(s1)), cfv(crnk, cv(s2)))))
  sseld(cv(hs0), c3, c2, wcel(cv(s0), c0))
  syl6sseqr(c3, c2, ciun(s0, c0, c3), wcel(cv(s0), c0))
  ssiun2(s0, c0, c3)
  inelcm(cv(hs0), c1, c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(cv(s0), c0))
  diff.hs0.w(wne(cin(c1, c2), emptycls))
}

thm cplem1(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ⊢ ∀(s0 ∈ c0,(c1 ≠ ∅ →(c1 ⋂ c2)≠ ∅))
  ⊣ c3 = { s1 ∈ c1 | ∀(s2 ∈ c1,(rank ` s1)⊆(rank ` s2))}
  ⊣ c2 = ⋃(s0 ∈ c0, c3)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s2, c0)
  ⊣ d(s2, c1)
} = {
  a1ii(∀(s0 ∈ c0,(c1 ≠ ∅ →(c1 ⋂ c2)≠ ∅)), d(s0, s1))
  a1ii(∀(s0 ∈ c0,(c1 ≠ ∅ →(c1 ⋂ c2)≠ ∅)), d(s0, s2))
  a1ii(∀(s0 ∈ c0,(c1 ≠ ∅ →(c1 ⋂ c2)≠ ∅)), d(s0, c0))
  a1ii(∀(s0 ∈ c0,(c1 ≠ ∅ →(c1 ⋂ c2)≠ ∅)), d(s1, c0))
  a1ii(∀(s0 ∈ c0,(c1 ≠ ∅ →(c1 ⋂ c2)≠ ∅)), d(s2, c0))
  rgen(s0, c0, (c1 ≠ ∅ →(c1 ⋂ c2)≠ ∅))
  syl5bi(s0 ∈ c0, c1 ≠ ∅, (c1 ⋂ c2)≠ ∅, ∃(hs0, hs0 ∈ c3))
  bitri(c1 ≠ ∅, ∃(hs0, hs0 ∈ c3), c3 ≠ ∅)
  necon3bii(c1, emptycls, c3, emptycls)
  bitr4i(c1 = ∅, c3 = ∅, { s1 ∈ c1 | ∀(s2 ∈ c1,(rank ` s1)⊆(rank ` s2))} = ∅)
  scott0(s1, s2, c1)
  eqeq1i(c3, emptycls, { s1 ∈ c1 | ∀(s2 ∈ c1,(rank ` s1)⊆(rank ` s2))})
  n0(hs0, c3)
  exlimdv(hs0, s0 ∈ c0, hs0 ∈ c3, (c1 ⋂ c2)≠ ∅)
  syl6(s0 ∈ c0, hs0 ∈ c3, (c1 ⋂ c2)≠ ∅, (hs0 ∈ c1 ∧ hs0 ∈ c2))
  jcad(s0 ∈ c0, hs0 ∈ c3, hs0 ∈ c1, hs0 ∈ c2)
  a1i(s0 ∈ c0, (hs0 ∈ c3 → hs0 ∈ c1))
  sseli(hs0, c3, c1)
  ssrab3(s1, c3, c1, ∀(s2 ∈ c1,(rank ` s1)⊆(rank ` s2)))
  sseld(hs0, c3, c2, s0 ∈ c0)
  syl6sseqr(c3, c2, ⋃(s0 ∈ c0, c3), s0 ∈ c0)
  ssiun2(s0, c0, c3)
  inelcm(hs0, c1, c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.w(s0 ∈ c0)
  diff.hs0.w((c1 ⋂ c2)≠ ∅)
}

  ineq2(cv(s0), ciun(s1, c0, crab(hs0, c1, wral(hs1, c1, wss(cfv(crnk, cv(hs0)), cfv(crnk, cv(hs1)))))), c1)
  cplem1(s1, hs0, hs1, c0, c1, ciun(s1, c0, crab(hs0, c1, wral(hs1, c1, wss(cfv(crnk, cv(hs0)), cfv(crnk, cv(hs1)))))), crab(hs0, c1, wral(hs1, c1, wss(cfv(crnk, cv(hs0)), cfv(crnk, cv(hs1))))))

blocks.name: cp
blocks.content: Collection Principle. This remarkable theorem scheme is in effect a very strong generalization of the Axiom of Replacement. The proof makes use of Scott's trick ~ scottex that collapses a proper class into a set of minimum rank. The wff ` ph ` can be thought of as ` ph ( x , y ) ` . Scheme "Collection Principle" of [Jech] p. 72. (Contributed by NM, 17-Oct-2003.)
blocks.origin:
thm cp(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, wff w0) {
  |- wex(s0, wral(s1, cv(s2), wi(wex(s3, w0), wrex(s3, cv(s0), w0))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s2, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(wex(s0, wral(s1, cv(s2), wi(wex(s3, w0), wrex(s3, cv(s0), w0)))), diffss(s1, s3))
  a1ii(wex(s0, wral(s1, cv(s2), wi(wex(s3, w0), wrex(s3, cv(s0), w0)))), diffss(s2, s3))
  a1ii(wex(s0, wral(s1, cv(s2), wi(wex(s3, w0), wrex(s3, cv(s0), w0)))), diffsw(s2, w0))
  mpbi(wex(s0, wral(s1, cv(s2), wi(wex(s3, w0), wrex(s3, cv(s0), w0)))), wex(s0, wral(s1, cv(s2), wi(wne(cab(s3, w0), emptycls), wne(cin(cab(s3, w0), cv(s0)), emptycls)))))
  cplem2(s0, s1, cv(s2), cab(s3, w0))
  vex(s2)
  exbii(s0, wral(s1, cv(s2), wi(wne(cab(s3, w0), emptycls), wne(cin(cab(s3, w0), cv(s0)), emptycls))), wral(s1, cv(s2), wi(wex(s3, w0), wrex(s3, cv(s0), w0))))
  ralbii(s1, cv(s2), wi(wne(cab(s3, w0), emptycls), wne(cin(cab(s3, w0), cv(s0)), emptycls)), wi(wex(s3, w0), wrex(s3, cv(s0), w0)))
  imbi12i(wne(cab(s3, w0), emptycls), wne(cin(cab(s3, w0), cv(s0)), emptycls), wex(s3, w0), wrex(s3, cv(s0), w0))
  abn0(s3, w0)
  3bitr4i(wne(cin(cab(s3, w0), cv(s0)), emptycls), wrex(s3, cv(s0), w0), wex(s3, wcel(cv(s3), cin(cab(s3, w0), cv(s0)))), wex(s3, wa(wcel(cv(s3), cv(s0)), w0)))
  exbii(s3, wcel(cv(s3), cin(cab(s3, w0), cv(s0))), wa(wcel(cv(s3), cv(s0)), w0))
  3bitri(wcel(cv(s3), cin(cab(s3, w0), cv(s0))), wa(wcel(cv(s3), cv(s0)), w0), wa(wcel(cv(s3), cab(s3, w0)), wcel(cv(s3), cv(s0))), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s3), cv(s0))))
  elin(cv(s3), cab(s3, w0), cv(s0))
  anbi1i(wcel(cv(s3), cab(s3, w0)), wcel(cv(s3), cv(s0)), w0)
  abid(s3, w0)
  ancom(w0, wcel(cv(s3), cv(s0)))
  n0f(s3, cin(cab(s3, w0), cv(s0)))
  nfin(s3, cab(s3, w0), cv(s0))
  nfab1(s3, w0)
  nfcv(s3, cv(s0))
  df-rex(s3, cv(s0), w0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s2)

  diff.cv.s(s3, s0)

blocks.name: bnd
blocks.content: A very strong generalization of the Axiom of Replacement (compare ~ zfrep6 ), derived from the Collection Principle ~ cp . Its strength lies in the rather profound fact that ` ph ( x , y ) ` does not have to be a "function-like" wff, as it does in the standard Axiom of Replacement. This theorem is sometimes called the Boundedness Axiom. (Contributed by NM, 17-Oct-2004.)
blocks.origin:
thm bnd(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wral(s0, cv(s1), wex(s2, w0)), wex(s3, wral(s0, cv(s1), wrex(s2, cv(s3), w0))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
  -| diffsw(s3, w0)
} = {
  19.37iv(s3, wral(s0, cv(s1), wex(s2, w0)), wral(s0, cv(s1), wrex(s2, cv(s3), w0)))
  eximii(s3, wi(wral(s0, cv(s1), wex(s2, w0)), wral(s0, cv(s1), wrex(s2, cv(s3), w0))), wral(s0, cv(s1), wi(wex(s2, w0), wrex(s2, cv(s3), w0))))
  cp(s3, s0, s1, s2, w0)
  ralim(s0, cv(s1), wex(s2, w0), wrex(s2, cv(s3), w0))
  diff.wral.s(s3, s0, cv(s1), wex(s2, w0))
  diff.cv.s(s3, s1)
  diff.wex.s(s3, s2, w0)
  diffss.ex(s3, s0)
  diffss.ex(s3, s1)
  diffss.ex(s3, s2)
}

blocks.name: kardex
blocks.content: The collection of all sets equinumerous to a set ` A ` and having the least possible rank is a set. This is the part of the justification of the definition of kard of [Enderton] p. 222. (Contributed by NM, 14-Dec-2003.)

thm kardex(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  ⊢ { s0 |(s0[≅]c0 ∧ ∀(s1,(s1[≅]c0 →(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))))} ∈ 𝕌
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  eqeltrri({ s0 |(s0[≅]c0 ∧ ∀(s1,(s1[≅]c0 →(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))))}, universe, { s0 ∈ { hs0 | hs0[≅]c0 } | ∀(s1 ∈ { hs0 | hs0[≅]c0 },(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))})
  eqtri({ s0 ∈ { hs0 | hs0[≅]c0 } | ∀(s1 ∈ { hs0 | hs0[≅]c0 },(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))}, { s0 |(s0[≅]c0 ∧ ∀(s1,(s1[≅]c0 →(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))))}, { s0 |(s0 ∈ { hs0 | hs0[≅]c0 } ∧ ∀(s1 ∈ { hs0 | hs0[≅]c0 },(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1)))})

  anbi12i(s0 ∈ { hs0 | hs0[≅]c0 }, ∀(s1 ∈ { hs0 | hs0[≅]c0 },(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1)), s0[≅]c0, ∀(s1,(s1[≅]c0 →(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))))

blocks.name: karden
blocks.content: If we allow the Axiom of Regularity, we can avoid the Axiom of Choice by defining the cardinal number of a set as the set of all sets equinumerous to it and having the least possible rank. This theorem proves the equinumerosity relationship for this definition (compare ~ carden ). The hypotheses correspond to the definition of kard of [Enderton] p. 222 (which we don't define separately since currently we do not use it elsewhere). This theorem along with ~ kardex justify the definition of kard. The restriction to the least rank prevents the proper class that would result from ` { x | x ~~ A } ` . (Contributed by NM, 18-Dec-2003.) (Revised by AV, 12-Jul-2022.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.content: Lemma for defining an emulation of Hilbert's epsilon. Hilbert's epsilon is described at ~ http://plato.stanford.edu/entries/epsilon-calculus/ . This theorem is equivalent to Hilbert's "transfinite axiom", described on that page, with the additional ` R We A ` antecedent. The element ` B ` is the epsilon that the theorem emulates. (Contributed by NM, 11-Mar-2004.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 25-Jun-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm htalem(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wwe(c0, c1), wne(c1, emptycls)), wcel(c2, c1))
  -| wcel(c1, universe)
  -| wceq(c2, crio(s0, c1, wral(s1, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
} = {
  syl5eqel(c2, c1, crio(s0, c1, wral(s1, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))), wa(wwe(c0, c1), wne(c1, emptycls)))
  syl(wa(wwe(c0, c1), wne(c1, emptycls)), wcel(crio(s0, c1, wral(s1, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))), c1), wreu(s0, c1, wral(s1, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))))
  syl13anc(wa(wwe(c0, c1), wne(c1, emptycls)), wreu(s0, c1, wral(s1, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0))))), wwe(c0, c1), wcel(c1, universe), wss(c1, c1), wne(c1, emptycls))
  simpl(wwe(c0, c1), wne(c1, emptycls))
  a1i(wa(wwe(c0, c1), wne(c1, emptycls)), wcel(c1, universe))
  ssidd(c1, wa(wwe(c0, c1), wne(c1, emptycls)))
  simpr(wwe(c0, c1), wne(c1, emptycls))
  wereu(s0, s1, c0, c1, c1, universe)
  riotacl(s0, c1, wral(s1, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s1), c0, cv(s0)))))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm htalem(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ≤ c1 ∧ c1 ≠ ∅)→ c2 ∈ c1)
  ⊣ c1 ∈ 𝕌
  ⊣ c2 = iota(s0 ∈ c1, ∀(s1 ∈ c1, ¬ s1[c0]s0))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
} = {
  syl5eqel(c2, c1, iota(s0 ∈ c1, ∀(s1 ∈ c1, ¬ s1[c0]s0)), (c0 ≤ c1 ∧ c1 ≠ ∅))
  syl((c0 ≤ c1 ∧ c1 ≠ ∅), iota(s0 ∈ c1, ∀(s1 ∈ c1, ¬ s1[c0]s0))∈ c1, ∃!(s0 ∈ c1, ∀(s1 ∈ c1, ¬ s1[c0]s0)))
  syl13anc((c0 ≤ c1 ∧ c1 ≠ ∅), ∃!(s0 ∈ c1, ∀(s1 ∈ c1, ¬ s1[c0]s0)), c0 ≤ c1, c1 ∈ 𝕌, c1 ⊆ c1, c1 ≠ ∅)
  simpl(c0 ≤ c1, c1 ≠ ∅)
  a1i((c0 ≤ c1 ∧ c1 ≠ ∅), c1 ∈ 𝕌)
  ssidd(c1, (c0 ≤ c1 ∧ c1 ≠ ∅))
  simpr(c0 ≤ c1, c1 ≠ ∅)
  wereu(s0, s1, c0, c1, c1, universe)
  riotacl(s0, c1, ∀(s1 ∈ c1, ¬ s1[c0]s0))
}

blocks.name: hta
blocks.content: A ZFC emulation of Hilbert's transfinite axiom. The set ` B ` has the properties of Hilbert's epsilon, except that it also depends on a well-ordering ` R ` . This theorem arose from discussions with Raph Levien on 5-Mar-2004 about translating the HOL proof language, which uses Hilbert's epsilon. See ~ http://us.metamath.org/downloads/choice.txt (copy of obsolete link ~ http://ghilbert.org/choice.txt) and ~ http://us.metamath.org/downloads/megillaward2005he.pdf . Hilbert's epsilon is described at ~ http://plato.stanford.edu/entries/epsilon-calculus/ . This theorem differs from Hilbert's transfinite axiom described on that page in that it requires ` R We A ` as an antecedent. Class ` A ` collects the sets of the least rank for which ` ph ( x ) ` is true. Class ` B ` , which emulates the epsilon, is the minimum element in a well-ordering ` R ` on ` A ` . If a well-ordering ` R ` on ` A ` can be expressed in a closed form, as might be the case if we are working with say natural numbers, we can eliminate the antecedent with modus ponens, giving us the exact equivalent of Hilbert's transfinite axiom. Otherwise, we replace ` R ` with a dummy setvar variable, say ` w ` , and attach ` w We A ` as an antecedent in each step of the ZFC version of the HOL proof until the epsilon is eliminated. At that point, ` B ` (which will have ` w ` as a free variable) will no longer be present, and we can eliminate ` w We A ` by applying ~ exlimiv and ~ weth , using ~ scottexs to establish the existence of ` A ` . For a version of this theorem scheme using class (meta)variables instead of wff (meta)variables, see ~ htalem . (Contributed by NM, 11-Mar-2004.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 25-Jun-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm hta(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wwe(c0, c1), wi(w0, wsbc(s0, c2, w0)))
  -| wceq(c1, cab(s0, wa(w0, wal(s1, wi(wsbc(s0, cv(s1), w0), wss(cfv(crnk, cv(s0)), cfv(crnk, cv(s1))))))))
  -| wceq(c2, crio(s2, c1, wral(s3, c1, wn(wbr(cv(s3), c0, cv(s2))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsc(s3, c0)
  -| diffsc(s3, c1)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  syl56(wwe(c0, c1), w0, wsbc(s0, c2, w0), wne(c1, emptycls), wcel(c2, c1))
  sylib(w0, wne(c1, emptycls), wex(s0, w0))
  19.8a(s0, w0)
  bitr4i(wex(s0, w0), wne(c1, emptycls), wne(cab(s0, wa(w0, wal(s1, wi(wsbc(s0, cv(s1), w0), wss(cfv(crnk, cv(s0)), cfv(crnk, cv(s1))))))), emptycls))
  scott0s(s0, s1, w0)
  neeq1i(c1, emptycls, cab(s0, wa(w0, wal(s1, wi(wsbc(s0, cv(s1), w0), wss(cfv(crnk, cv(s0)), cfv(crnk, cv(s1))))))))
  ex(wwe(c0, c1), wne(c1, emptycls), wcel(c2, c1))
  htalem(s2, s3, c0, c1, c2)
  eqeltri(c1, universe, cab(s0, wa(w0, wal(s1, wi(wsbc(s0, cv(s1), w0), wss(cfv(crnk, cv(s0)), cfv(crnk, cv(s1))))))))
  scottexs(s0, s1, w0)
  sylibr(wcel(c2, c1), wsbc(s0, c2, w0), wcel(c2, cab(s0, w0)))
  sseli(c2, c1, cab(s0, w0))
  eqsstri(c1, cab(s0, w0), cab(s0, wa(w0, wal(s1, wi(wsbc(s0, cv(s1), w0), wss(cfv(crnk, cv(s0)), cfv(crnk, cv(s1))))))))
  ss2abi(s0, wa(w0, wal(s1, wi(wsbc(s0, cv(s1), w0), wss(cfv(crnk, cv(s0)), cfv(crnk, cv(s1)))))), w0)
  simpl(w0, wal(s1, wi(wsbc(s0, cv(s1), w0), wss(cfv(crnk, cv(s0)), cfv(crnk, cv(s1))))))
  df-sbc(s0, c2, w0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm hta(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (c0 ≤ c1 →(w0 →[c2 / s0]w0))
  ⊣ c1 = { s0 |(w0 ∧ ∀(s1,([s1 / s0]w0 →(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))))}
  ⊣ c2 = iota(s2 ∈ c1, ∀(s3 ∈ c1, ¬ s3[c0]s2))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s2, s3)
  ⊣ d(s2, c0)
  ⊣ d(s2, c1)
  ⊣ d(s3, c0)
  ⊣ d(s3, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, w0)
} = {
  syl56(c0 ≤ c1, w0, [c2 / s0]w0, c1 ≠ ∅, c2 ∈ c1)
  sylib(w0, c1 ≠ ∅, ∃(s0, w0))
  19.8a(s0, w0)
  bitr4i(∃(s0, w0), c1 ≠ ∅, { s0 |(w0 ∧ ∀(s1,([s1 / s0]w0 →(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))))} ≠ ∅)
  scott0s(s0, s1, w0)
  neeq1i(c1, emptycls, { s0 |(w0 ∧ ∀(s1,([s1 / s0]w0 →(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))))})
  ex(c0 ≤ c1, c1 ≠ ∅, c2 ∈ c1)
  htalem(s2, s3, c0, c1, c2)
  eqeltri(c1, universe, { s0 |(w0 ∧ ∀(s1,([s1 / s0]w0 →(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))))})
  scottexs(s0, s1, w0)
  sylibr(c2 ∈ c1, [c2 / s0]w0, c2 ∈ { s0 | w0 })
  sseli(c2, c1, { s0 | w0 })
  eqsstri(c1, { s0 | w0 }, { s0 |(w0 ∧ ∀(s1,([s1 / s0]w0 →(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))))})
  ss2abi(s0, (w0 ∧ ∀(s1,([s1 / s0]w0 →(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1)))), w0)
  simpl(w0, ∀(s1,([s1 / s0]w0 →(rank ` s0)⊆(rank ` s1))))
  df-sbc(s0, c2, w0)
}
